channel.description: Recent content in Posts on JuHye Mun

item.title: Week3
item.description: Week 3: Kinetic Sculpture This week, I created a Valentine’s day themed rotating bird as a kinetic sculpture. This was definitely a journey – it evolved into something much more fun that I anticipated! Materials I used the M0 Metro Circuit from Adafruit, a potentiometer, a moter, and the breadboard from the PS 70 kit to start. Circuit inspired by class: Circuit Attached the motor to the lego wheels and 3D printed structures from the hardware packet.

item.title: Week 2
item.description: Press Fit Construction Kit For this assignment, I collaborated with Hugh and Amy to create a cardboard press-fit kit for lampshades. I got this idea from a beautiful wooden lamp that I had seen on the internet: Photo from google images I realized that none of us were artists, and so we decided to create geometric patterns that would create a “starlight” effect over a lightbulb, like these:

item.title: PS 70 Project Proposal
item.description: For my final project, I aim to build a midi controller where a person can change instrument sounds just by holding their hand up or horizontally or down. Because of the “hands off” concept, the musician/producer doesn’t have to rely on a bulky piece of hardware. The project could incorporate different sensors such as light, movement, and visual sensors (such as a camera). This product would simulate a two-dimensional plane, where each axis represents some customizable parameter to an instrument.
